title: Quiz of the week: Who joined James Corden's lockdown show?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: The staff battling coronavirus in a Barcelona ICU
description: The head of the intensive care unit at one of Spain's biggest hospitals show us what staff are facing.

title: MI6: World War Two workers in rare 'forbidden' footage
description: Rare footage is released of workers at MI6 during WW2 which has never been seen by the public before.

title: Virus threatens next generation of smartphones
description: The latest smartphones might be delayed due to disrupted supply chains and shoppers staying at home.

title: The Coronavirus Newscast: 'It's a heck of a target'
description: The BBC’s Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg looks at the government's aim for 100,000 coronavirus tests a day by May.

title: Coronavirus: A US tourist town telling visitors to stay away
description: Its state slogan is "live free or die" - but locals now fear being overwhelmed by tourists.

title: Clap for Carers: UK applauds NHS staff and key workers
description: A second "Clap for Carers" tribute saw the country salute NHS staff and other key workers dealing with the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Top-flight footballers should take pay cut, says health secretary Hancock
description: The "first thing" Premier League footballers can do is "take a pay cut and play their part" to help out during the coronavirus pandemic, says health secretary Matt Hancock.

title: Coronavirus: BA reaches deal to suspend thousands of workers
description: The airline will temporarily suspend more than 30,000 of its workers after reaching a deal with unions.

title: Coronavirus: Health experts 'frustrated' by low UK virus testing
description: Some 2,921 people have died with coronavirus in UK hospitals, as PHE calls for more NHS staff testing.

title: Jones should keep 'competitive edge', even if he does 'slightly cross line' on occasions
description: RFU boss Bill Sweeney urges Eddie Jones to keep his "competitive edge", even if the England head coach does "slightly cross the line" on occasions.

title: Eddie Large: Comedian dies aged 78 with coronavirus
description: The peformer, who was 78, found fame as part of the double act Little and Large.

title: Doctors face agonising care decisions
description: Medics are told they will need to decide who gets the most critical care as coronavirus spreads

title: Coronavirus: Paramedic 'emotional' as stranger buys food shop
description: Applause from shoppers "made me feel special after a tough run of shifts", says David Tillyer.

title: Coronavirus: Stranded pair 'don't know' when they will return
description: The two Londoners have been stuck in an Argentine city since a coronavirus quarantine was imposed.

title: Newcastle Falcons promoted to Premiership
description: Newcastle Falcons' promotion back to the Premiership is confirmed by the Rugby Football Union.

title: The racing driver turned PPE delivery man - how motorsport is helping coronavirus fight
description: Formula E's Alex Sims is keeping sharp behind the wheel of his delivery van, as others in motorsport and cycling help to fight coronavirus.

title: Presenter chooses poetic tribute to NHS
description: BBC presenter Sophie Raworth reads These Are The Hands by Michael Rosen.

title: Don't send rainbow pictures to Nightingale hospital, NHS says
description: Despite a social media shout-out for rainbow artwork, the NHS has now asked people to share their pictures online only

title: Adam Schlesinger: Stacy’s Mom songwriter dies aged 52 with coronavirus
description: Tom Hanks and Mark Ronson are among those paying tribute to the late Grammy-winner Adam Schlesinger.

title: Labour leadership ballot closes
description: Either Rebecca Long-Bailey, Lisa Nandy or Sir Keir Starmer will be announced as leader on Saturday.

title: Aintree to donate 10,000 tickets to NHS for next year's Grand National festival
description: Aintree donates 10,000 tickets for day one of next year's Grand National festival to NHS staff and carers on Merseyside.

title: Coronavirus: Pets at Home seeing ‘exceptional demand’
description: 'Vital role' of animals for households during the coronavirus pandemic lifts retailer's profit.

title: Cricket statistician Lewis - of the Duckworth-Lewis method - dies aged 78
description: Tony Lewis, who co-devised the Duckworth-Lewis method for settling weather-affected limited-overs cricket matches, dies at the age of 78.

title: Coronavirus: Boots staff feel 'unsafe' as shoppers still browse makeup
description: Employees fear risk of coronavirus when staffing aisles selling non-essential items.

title: Coronavirus: Keeping Chelsea Pensioners safe
description: The Chelsea Pensioners are among the UK's most famous war veterans, and life for them under coronavirus is now very different.

title: BBC to air memorable sporting highlights including London 2012, Euro '96 and Wimbledon
description: The London 2012 Olympics and Euro '96 are just some of the memorable moments that viewers can relive during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: NHS worker 'let down' before death
description: Thomas Harvey's family claim with the "right" personal protective equipment he might not have died.

title: Coronavirus: Shoppers face 'essential items' confusion
description: The government says you should only shop for "basic necessities" - but what does that actually mean?

title: BBC radio stars lead the nation in a mass singalong
description: Five BBC stations joined forces to get the country singing to Prince and Florence + The Machine.

title: Why Anne Tyler won't be writing about the coronavirus
description: One of America's greatest living writers says it would be "wrongheaded" to mention the virus in a book.

title: Coronavirus: Photos show deserted lockdown locations at high noon
description: Photographers around the world have taken pictures showing lockdown locations with a running theme.

title: Coronavirus: Where has all the hand sanitiser gone?
description: Shelves all over the world are empty - it turns out more alcohol is needed, to ramp up production.

title: Coronavirus: Volunteers help protect NHS workers
description: The army of volunteers making essential supplies for NHS workers fighting Covid-19.

title: Dua Lipa interview: How I released an album from lockdown
description: The pop star dreamt up her new album in Las Vegas, but she's releasing it from an Airbnb in London.

title: Bafta Games Awards: How to host a ceremony in lockdown
description: The Bafta Games Awards will be the first major awards to take place during social distancing rules.

title: Coronavirus: How will it change national security and spying?
description: The pandemic has raised questions about whether global health should be a more central part of national security.

title: Recovering from coronavirus: Three harrowing stories of surviving Covid-19
description: We have spoken to three people who were hospitalised after contracting coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Meet the ex-NHS staff who are returning to work
description: Thousands of ex-NHS staff have returned to work to help fight coronavirus after a government appeal.
